availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph M. Plummer (Fleming County, Kentucky, blacksmith.)

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, blacksmith. Kentucky native. Son of Joseph C. Plummer and Elizabeth Plummer. Married to Sarah F. Shepherd Plummer in Carter County, Kentucky, on January 21, 1863. Father of Elizabeth Plummer and William Plummer. Attended school in Fleming County, Kentucky, in 1850. Blacksmith in Fleming County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Division 2, p. 406B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 2, p. 674.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Poplar Plains Precinct, p. 476B.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 18110.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Carter County Marriages, Film 001759301.
"Fleming Farmer Drops Dead," The Lexington Herald (Lexington, KY), June 5, 1919, p. 5.
